page.title: 12PETS
page.content: Lisa and I asked people in our village questions about the{pets}they keep but we only went to the people we knew. We asked them many questions, such as{how many}pets they have,{what kind {of}pets they are and so on. We found out that the average number of pets to own is about three. Their ages vary from{2 months to 13}years. They are mostly dogs, rabbits, cats and rodents. The{exercise}they are given varies, from some remaining in a cage whilst others are taken for long walks. The pets were mostly{female}and most of them had{nicknames}such as Mrs. White, Mr. Brown, Pip and so on. There was hardly anyone who did not own a pet. Pets are popular, probably because we live in a village where there is a lot of open space.
